ai-mn108:25.5_0: “Indeed it is, brahmin. And it is like that owing to such protectors and guardians as yourself.”
ai-mn108:25.6_0: “Indeed it is, Master Ānanda. And it is like that owing to such protectors and guardians as yourself.
ai-mn108:25.7_0: For the venerables do in fact meditate and make a habit of meditating.
ai-mn108:25.8_0: This one time, Master Ānanda, Master Gotama was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
ai-mn108:25.9_0: So I went there to see him.
ai-mn108:25.10_0: And there he spoke about meditation in many ways.
ai-mn108:25.11_0: He meditated, and made a habit of meditating.
ai-mn108:25.12_0: And he praised all kinds of meditation.”
ai-mn108:26.1_0: “No, brahmin, the Buddha didn’t praise all of this kind of meditation.
ai-mn108:26.2_0: And what kind of meditation did he not praise?
ai-mn108:26.3_0: It’s when someone’s heart is overcome and mired in sensual desire, and they don’t truly understand the escape from sensual desire that has arisen.
ai-mn108:26.4_0: Harboring sensual desire within they meditate and concentrate and contemplate and ruminate.
ai-mn108:26.5_0: Their heart is overcome and mired in ill will ...

ai-mn108:26.12_0: Harboring doubt within they meditate and concentrate and contemplate and ruminate.
ai-mn108:26.13_0: The Buddha didn’t praise this kind of meditation.
ai-mn108:27.1_0: And what kind of meditation did he praise?
ai-mn108:27.2_0: Take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.

ai-mn108:28.1_0: “Well, Master Ānanda, it seems that Master Gotama criticized the kind of meditation that deserves criticism and praised that deserving of praise.
ai-mn108:28.2_0: Well, now, Master Ānanda, I must go.
